intro: Geissorhiza demissa, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, cylindrical fruit capsules. Geissorhiza demissa is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
